p: First isolated in 1966 by Prokopenko from the fruits of Libanotis intermedia Rupr. (common name “moon carrot”, syn. Seseli libanotis (L.) W. D. J. Koch, Apiaceae) [ 9], 7-isopentenyloxycoumarin was believed until a few years ago to be part of the phytochemical pool of a very restricted group of plant families (e.g., Apiaceae, Asteraceae, Rutaceae) [ 6]. Recent investigations carried out during the last 5 years did widen the number of species and natural sources in general from which the title oxyprenylated coumarin can be found.
